trans-unit.source: Overview of the Service Fabric Reliable Actors KVSActorStateProvider Configuration
trans-unit.target: Overview of the Service Fabric Reliable Actors KVSActorStateProvider Configuration

trans-unit.source: Learn about configuring Service Fabric Stateful actors of type 'KVSActorStateProvider'
trans-unit.target: Learn about configuring Service Fabric Stateful actors of type 'KVSActorStateProvider'

trans-unit.source: KVSActorStateProvider's default configuration can be modified by changing the "settings.xml" file generated in the Visual Studio package root under the "Config" folder for the specified actor in question.
trans-unit.target: KVSActorStateProvider's default configuration can be modified by changing the "settings.xml" file generated in the Visual Studio package root under the "Config" folder for the specified actor in question.

trans-unit.source: Service-Fabric runtime looks for pre-defined section names in the "settings.xml" file and consumes the configuration values while creating the underlying runtime components.
trans-unit.target: Service-Fabric runtime looks for pre-defined section names in the "settings.xml" file and consumes the configuration values while creating the underlying runtime components.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Do **NOT** delete/modify the section names of the following configurations in the "settings.xml" file that is generated in the Visual Studio Solution.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Do **NOT** delete/modify the section names of the following configurations in the "settings.xml" file that is generated in the Visual Studio Solution.

trans-unit.source: Replicator Security Configurations are used to secure the communication channel that is used during replication.
trans-unit.target: Replicator Security Configurations are used to secure the communication channel that is used during replication.

trans-unit.source: This means services will not be able to see each other's replication traffic, ensuring the data that is made highly available is also secure.
trans-unit.target: This means services will not be able to see each other's replication traffic, ensuring the data that is made highly available is also secure.

trans-unit.source: By default, an empty security configuration section does not enable replication security.
trans-unit.target: By default, an empty security configuration section does not enable replication security.

trans-unit.source: Replicator Configurations are used to configure the replicator that is responsible for making the Actor State Provider state highly reliable.
trans-unit.target: Replicator Configurations are used to configure the replicator that is responsible for making the Actor State Provider state highly reliable.

trans-unit.source: The default configuration is generated by the Visual Studio template and should suffice.
trans-unit.target: The default configuration is generated by the Visual Studio template and should suffice.

trans-unit.source: This section talks about additional configurations that are available to tune the replicator.
trans-unit.target: This section talks about additional configurations that are available to tune the replicator.

trans-unit.source: Time period for which the replicator at the secondary waits after receiving an operation before sending back an acknowledgement to the primary.
trans-unit.target: Time period for which the replicator at the secondary waits after receiving an operation before sending back an acknowledgement to the primary.

trans-unit.source: Any other acknowledgements to be sent for operations processed within this interval are sent as one response.
trans-unit.target: Any other acknowledgements to be sent for operations processed within this interval are sent as one response.

trans-unit.source: IP address and port that the primary/secondary replicator will use to communicate with other replicators in the replica set.
trans-unit.target: IP address and port that the primary/secondary replicator will use to communicate with other replicators in the replica set.

trans-unit.source: This should reference a TCP Resource Endpoint in the service manifest.
trans-unit.target: This should reference a TCP Resource Endpoint in the service manifest.

trans-unit.source: Refer to [Service Manifest Resources](service-fabric-service-manifest-resources.md) to read more about defining endpoint resources in service manifest.
trans-unit.target: Refer to [Service Manifest Resources](service-fabric-service-manifest-resources.md) to read more about defining endpoint resources in service manifest.

trans-unit.source: Time period after which the replicator re-transmits a message if it does not receive an acknowledgement for an operation.
trans-unit.target: Time period after which the replicator re-transmits a message if it does not receive an acknowledgement for an operation.

trans-unit.source: Maximum size of replication data that can be transmitted in a single message.
trans-unit.target: Maximum size of replication data that can be transmitted in a single message.

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of operations in the primary queue.
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of operations in the primary queue.

trans-unit.source: An Operation is freed up after the primary replicator receives an acknowledgement from all the secondary replicators.This value must be greater than 64 and a power of 2.
trans-unit.target: An Operation is freed up after the primary replicator receives an acknowledgement from all the secondary replicators.This value must be greater than 64 and a power of 2.

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of operations in the secondary queue.
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of operations in the secondary queue.

trans-unit.source: An Operation is freed up after making its state highly available through persistence.
trans-unit.target: An Operation is freed up after making its state highly available through persistence.

trans-unit.source: This value must be greater than 64 and a power of 2.
trans-unit.target: This value must be greater than 64 and a power of 2.

trans-unit.source: Store Configurations are used to configure the local store that is used to persist the state that is being replicated.
trans-unit.target: Store Configurations are used to configure the local store that is used to persist the state that is being replicated.

trans-unit.source: The default configuration is generated by the Visual Studio template and should suffice.
trans-unit.target: The default configuration is generated by the Visual Studio template and should suffice.

trans-unit.source: This section talks about additional configurations that are available to tune the local store.
trans-unit.target: This section talks about additional configurations that are available to tune the local store.

trans-unit.source: Sets the maximum batching interval for durable local store commits.
trans-unit.target: Sets the maximum batching interval for durable local store commits.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of version pages in the local store database.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of version pages in the local store database.

trans-unit.source: It determines the maximum number of outstanding transactions.
trans-unit.target: It determines the maximum number of outstanding transactions.

trans-unit.source: A value of '0' results in the lowest possible latency, at the cost of throughput (as more acknowledgement messages must be sent and processed, each containing fewer acknowledgements).
trans-unit.target: A value of '0' results in the lowest possible latency, at the cost of throughput (as more acknowledgement messages must be sent and processed, each containing fewer acknowledgements).

trans-unit.source: The larger the value for BatchAcknowledgementInterval, the higher the overall replication throughput, at the cost of higher operation latency.
trans-unit.target: The larger the value for BatchAcknowledgementInterval, the higher the overall replication throughput, at the cost of higher operation latency.

trans-unit.source: This directly translates to the latency of transaction commits.
trans-unit.target: This directly translates to the latency of transaction commits.
